title: autometa pipeline parameters
description: Autometa: Automated Extraction of Microbial Genomes from Shotgun Metagenomes

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.help_text:
Use this to specify the location of your input FASTA files. For example:

A single FASTA file: 
```bash
--input 'path/to/data/sample.fna'
```

Multiple FASTA files: 

```bash
--input 'path/to/data/sample_*.fna'
```

Please note the following requirements:

1. The path must be enclosed in quotes

interim_dir.description: Absolute (full) path of directory for intermediate files
interim_dir.help_text: Directory for storing files created during intermediate steps but which are interesting enough to keep for debugging or analyzing with other tools

outdir.description: Absolute (full) path of directory where the results will be saved.

tracedir.description: Absolute (full) path of directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

length_cutoff.description: Minimum contig length to use as input to Autometa

pca_dimensions.description: Number of dimensions of which to reduce the initial k-mer frequencies matrix

embedding_dimensions.description: Final dimensions of the kmer frequencies matrix

clustering_method.description: Cluster contigs using which clustering method. Choices are "dbscan" and "hdbscan"

classification_method.description: Which clustering method to use for unclustered recruitment step. Choices are "decision_tree" and "random_forest"

classification_kmer_pca_dimensions.description: Number of dimensions of which to reduce the initial k-mer frequencies matrix

completeness.description: Minimum completeness needed to keep a cluster (default is atleast 20% complete)

purity.description: Minimum purity needed to keep a cluster (default is at least 95% pure)

gc_stddev_limit.description: Which clusters to keep depending on the GC% std.dev (default is 5%)

cov_stddev_limit.description: Which clusters to keep depending on the covergae std.dev (default is 25%)

single_db_dir.description: Directory containing databases required for taxonomy assignment

binning_starting_rank.description: Which taxonomic rank to start the binning from. Choices are "superkingdom", "phylum", "class", "order", "family", "genus", "species"

kingdom.description: Bin contigs belonging to this kingdom. Choices are "bacteria" and "archaea"

parallel_split_fasta.help_text:
This will (at least) double the amount of disk space that your decompressed metagenome occupies.
Use the parameter --store_split_fasta_in_ram=true to use RAM and skip the storing intermediate split FASTA file on disk

store_split_fasta_in_ram.description: Skip writing split FASTA to disk, use RAM

fasta_split_size.description: Size of files to split FASTA input into for parallelization.

max_time.description: Max time a *single* process is allowed run

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

validate_params.description: Whether to validate parameters on intitiation

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: This works exactly as with `--email`, except emails are only sent if the workflow is not successful.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.
plaintext_email.help_text: Set to receive plain-text e-mails instead of HTML formatted.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.
